bioghist.p: Milton Charles Nahm (1903-1991) joined the philosophy faculty of Bryn Mawr College in 1930. He was named a professor in 1945 and served as chair of the Department of Philosophy from 1946 to 1970, when he retired and was named professor emeritus. In 1970 he became Leslie Clark Professor in the Humanities. Nahm received undergraduate and graduate degrees (including a Ph.D. in 1933) at the University of Pennsylvania and two additional undergraduate degrees at Oxford University, England, which he attended as a Rhodes Scholar. He was the author of five books, including Selections from Early Greek Philosophy.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of the papers of Milton and Elinor Nahm. Included are personal and professional correspondence; drafts and reprints of articles; published and unpublished manuscripts; legal and financial documents; awards and diplomas; photographs; materials related to the Owl Bookshop; journals kept by Elinor Nahm's parents, and scrapbooks of class notes and articles from the Bryn Mawr Alumnae Bulletin, 1928-1978.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
